meanings.definition: The act of erasing or rubbing out.
meanings.sent1: I used erasion to remove the mistake from my paper.
meanings.sent2: The erasion of the pencil marks left the paper clean.
meanings.sent3: The erasion of the drawing made it disappear like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like an erasion, wiping away the past.
meanings.sent5: The erasion on the whiteboard was so thorough, not a trace was left.

meanings.definition: The state of being erased or rubbed out.
meanings.sent1: The erasion on the document was evident.
meanings.sent2: After the erasion, only faint marks remained.
meanings.sent3: The erasion on the wall looked like a ghostly message.
meanings.sent4: His presence felt like an erasion in the room, fading away.
meanings.sent5: The erasion on the painting left a blank space that caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The process of removing or eliminating something.
meanings.sent1: The erasion of the stain required strong detergent.
meanings.sent2: With careful erasion, the graffiti was removed.
meanings.sent3: The erasion of the weeds made the garden look neat.
meanings.sent4: Time was the ultimate erasion, fading the colors of the old photograph.
meanings.sent5: The erasion of doubts from her mind brought clarity and peace.
